III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for
the continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth D was injured by other youth. Staff did not intervene.
Investigation Interviews
Consultant 2 interviewed Complainant, also Foster Care Worker
via phone. She said Youth D had her hair done in four or five
braids on 1/5/24 and one braid was gone by 1/9/24. Complainant
indicated another youth (Youth J) pulled the braid out of Youth D’s
head and Youth D filed charges against her on 1/10/24.
Government Worker 1 completed a well-being check on Youth D
on 1/10/24.
Consultant 2 attempted to interview Youth D at the facility on
1/11/24, but she was at the hospital being evaluated for a
headache apparently resulting from the incident with Youth J.
This investigation was transferred to me on 1/17/24.
I interviewed Youth D jointly with Government Worker 1 on
1/22/24. She has been at the facility for six months. On 1/6/24
Youth D said she was arguing with a peer and Youth J came up
behind her and pulled one of her braids out of her head. “Staff 1
and Staff 2 were trying to stop Youth J. Youth J threw the remote
at Staff 1 and it hit her in the throat…Youth J tried to stab me with
a pen but hit Staff 1 instead…I was moved to another unit and
talked to police about it.”
I interviewed Youth J jointly with Government Worker 1. They use
they/them pronouns. Youth J said Youth D threw a shoe and it hit
them in their face. “Youth D started punching me in the face. I
grabbed her hair. Staff grabbed my hand, and it had her hair in it.”
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were on the unit and intervened. “Staff 2
calmed me down. Youth D kept trying to get to me…Staff 1 was
trying to calm Youth D.” Youth J said she had minor scratches
and a bruise as a result, but they were not seriously injured.
2

I interviewed Staff 2 jointly with Government Worker 1 and Rights
Officer present. He has worked at the facility for ten months.
Staff 2 said he was working on an adjoining unit and heard
commotion on Peace wing. When he arrived on the wing, Youth
D was verbally and physically aggressive and Youth A was
running away from her. “They spoke of each other’s deceased
parents. Youth J became triggered. Youth D threw two shoes at
Youth J, and I felt water. Youth J became verbally and physically
aggressive. They ran around the sofa. Youth J had a pen in their
hand. I grabbed their wrist and safely removed it from their hand.
Staff 1 was between Youth D and Youth J and de-escalating
Youth D. Youth J reached over and grabbed Youth D’s hair and
the whole braid (which covered a quarter of her head) came out. I
called Team Leader. Team Leader decided to remove Youth D
(from the wing) for safety. I observed a couple scratches around
Youth D's neck and face. Her scalp was red and exposed.”
On 1/22/24, I attempted to interview Staff 1 but she was on
medical leave. I interviewed Staff 1 jointly with Government
Worker 1 on 1/24/24 via video conference. She has worked at the
facility for eight months. Staff 1 recalled on 1/5/24 Youth D and
another youth argued. Youth D chased the other youth, then
Youth J attacked Youth D. Youth D had a pen in her hand. “Me
and Staff 2 stood between them, so Youth D didn’t stab Youth J.
Youth D and Youth J kept trying to run toward each other. Youth
J grabbed Youth D’s hair and ripped the braid out. Youth D had
scratches near her eye and her head was very red. Team Leader
looked at her head and took Youth D off of the wing.
Video
I viewed video of the incident on 1/6/24. Staff 1 and Staff 2 are
talking with Youth D. Youth A and Youth J are standing in the far
corner of the room. Youth D throws something across the room
toward Youth A and Youth J. Youth J approaches Youth D and
tries to physically engage. Staff 2 holds Youth J while Staff 1
holds Youth D back. The staff are no longer able to hold the girls
and they start exchanging blows. Youth J grabs Youth D’s braid
in her hand and rips it from her head. Staff 2 is able to guide
Youth J away from Youth D.
Documents reviewed:
An incident report by Staff 2 dated 1/6/24 at 8:45pm indicated
Youth J became aggressive and ran toward Youth D. Staff 2
called a verbal wing clear (segregation for safety). Youth D and
Youth J started fighting. Staff 1 and Staff 2 started to break up
the fight. Youth J was able to grab Youth D’s hair and pulled her
3

braid/hair out. Youth J was able to grab a pen and started trying
to stab Youth D with it. Staff 2 was able to remove the pen from
Youth J’s hand. Youth D was moved off the wing for her safety.
Police were contacted by Youth D’s Foster Care Worker.
Government Worker 1 had no findings.
Analysis Staff 1 and Staff 2 were supervising and intervened but were
unable to prevent Youth J from pulling out Youth D’s braid/hair.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth did not receive timely medical attention after being injured
by another youth on 1/6/24.
Investigation Interview
I observed a 1-inch vertical scar on Youth D’s collar bone which
she reported was caused by Youth J’s fingernail. A photo sent
with the complaint showed a large bald area on the side where
Youth D’s braid and hair were torn out of her head.
On 1/7/24, Youth D said Supervisor gave her ointment, alcohol
wipes, a bandage and oil for her head. On 1/8/24, Nurse 1 came
and put ointment on her scratches and head. On 1/11/24 Youth D
was transported to Henry Ford Fairlane Emergency Department.
“They checked out my hair to make sure it was growing back.”
Documents reviewed
A body chart completed by Staff 2 the evening of 1/6/24 illustrated
scratches on Youth D’s face, soreness in her left wrist and a large
bald area on the left side of her head where her braid and hair
were pulled out.
A telephone triage note written by Nurse 2 dated 1/7/24 at 7:55am
indicated Team Leader contacted Nurse 2 reporting Youth D
complained of pain and tenderness of the scalp with no bleeding.
4

Team Leader was advised to treat on-site with cold compresses
and pain medication.
A medical progress note by Nurse 1 dated 1/8/24 at 2:30pm
indicated Nurse 1 observed left side of Youth D’s hair had been
ripped out from the roots and left scalp was exposed…Youth also
has scratches to left side of face and neck and some small cuts to
left ear all superficial. Nurse 2 cleansed areas with peroxide and
applied bacitracin to cuts. A small amount of bacitracin in a
medicine cup was left on youth’s desk to apply after hygiene.
At the direction of Government Worker 1 Youth D was seen at
Henry Ford Fairlane Emergency Department on 1/11/24.
Discharge instructions indicate she was diagnosed with
Excoriation and Ibuprofen was recommended for pain.
Government Worker 1 had no findings.
Analysis Documents indicate Youth D was provided appropriate and timely
medical attention for her injuries.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
